conversations.content: Am I free for lunch at 12:00 on 2024-05-19? If so, please create an event with Sarah Baker at 12:00 for one hour, titled 'Lunch' and with description Catch up over lunch.. Don't forget to add her email address to the participants.

<function_thought>
To determine if Emma Johnson is free for lunch on 2024-05-19 at 12:00, I first need to retrieve the calendar events for that specific day. This will allow me to see if there are any events scheduled at that time. Once I have the list of events, I can determine if she is free and proceed to create the lunch event if she is available.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_day_calendar_events(day="2024-05-19")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
On 2024-05-19, Emma Johnson has two scheduled events:
1. **Project Kick-off** from 10:00 to 11:00.
2. **One-on-One with Manager** from 11:00 to 11:30.

Since the lunch is planned for 12:00, Emma is free for that time slot. I will proceed to create the calendar event for lunch with Sarah Baker at 12:00 for one hour, with the title 'Lunch' and the description 'Catch up over lunch.' However, I need to confirm Sarah Baker's email address to include her as a participant in the event. I'll search for her contact details.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[search_contacts_by_name(query="Sarah Baker")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I found Sarah Baker's email address: sarah.baker@gmail.com. Now that I have all the necessary information, I can proceed to create the calendar event for lunch with her at 12:00 for one hour.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[create_calendar_event(title="Lunch", start_time="2024-05-19 12:00", end_time="2024-05-19 13:00", description="Catch up over lunch.", participants=["sarah.baker@gmail.com"])]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
